description: Derived from a "Grill It! With Bobby Flay" episode
title: Bloody Mary With Horseradish

description: This is the pork loin dish I prepared Mike and Dana Marchetti while visiting in August of 2005.  This dish works extremely well with chicken as well; you just cut up a 4lb fryer into 8 pieces and remove the skin, then proceed exactly as you would with the pork.
title: Braised Pork With Tomatillo Sauce

description: Modified from a terrific Bon Appetit recipe, which we cut in half and replaced cilanto for the basil the original recipe calls for.
note: Serves two hungry, late middle-aged adults.
title: Curried Ground Shrimp And Noodles

description: Found on the Sonoma Mountain Sausages website.
title: Fresh Jalapeño Sausage
Grilled Broccoli with Avocado and Sesame

description: I pulled this together one night for Jessica's son Julien.  It's a summer recipe, entirely dependent upon the quality of the ingredients.
title: Grilled Prawns And Corn With Mango Salsa

description: Modified from an SF Chronicle recipe, from San Francisco's Green Chile Kitchen.
note: Green Chile Kitchen owner Trevor Logan says the sauce may be made 1-2 days ahead.  The tortillas may be fried for more texture prior to assembling the dish.
title: Homestyle Green Chile Chicken Enchiladas

description: This stuff is great. The recipe is from Rosie Hawthorne's Kitchens Are Monkey Business blog, and she got it from Lisa Fain's Homesick Texan blog. Needless to say, I did not need to modify it!
title: Jalapeno Buttermilk Dressing

description: Lunch at Oakland's Wood Tavern was all pastrami sandwiches and surprisingly refreshing coleslaw.  Unable to find the recipe online, we tried to replicate it - and got pretty close!
title: Jalapeno Cilantro Coleslaw

description: Roasted chicken with Jalapeno wheels inserted under the skin.  Serves 4
title: Jalapeno Roasted Chicken

description: Spice-rubbed chicken stuffed with Jalapenos
title: Jalapeno Stuffed Chicken

description: Inspired by Melissa Clark's One-Pot Turkey Chili and Biscuits recipe, this is a great use of the Impossible Beef product
title: Jessica's Cast Iron Chili and Cheddar Biscuits

description: A pretty common recipe, jazzed up a little.  It is completely dependent upon the quality of the ingredients, so don't make this in the winter!
title: Mango Salsa

description: Modified from an amazing Yotam Ottolenghi recipe Lamb Meatball and Semolina Dumpling Soup With Collard Greens, substituting Impossible Beef for Ottolenghi's lamb.
note: Although the recipe says it takes 50 minutes to prepare, this will actually take 2-1/2 hours from start to finish
title: Meatball and Semolina Dumpling Stew With Collard Greens

description: A mash-up from a few different sources, I this this one right the first time out (beginner's luck).
note: Displace some the tomato sauce with a 7-ounce can Salsa Casera as an alternative.
title: Mexican Rice

description: Cobbled together from a number of sources, other pepper types and other spices may be substituted in this flexible recipe.
title: Pickled Jalapeno Peppers

description: Inspired from a Poached Eggs & Corn Cakes recipe.
title: Poached Eggs with Corn Cakes & Mango Salsa

description:
Porchetta is traditionally a roasted whole, de-boned suckling pig; this ain't that. ;-)
I compiled the ingredients list from a number of sources, but I followed Alabama Chef Haller Magee's cooking instructions.
My mother-in-law told my wife this was the best meal she had in her entire life!
note:
Serves at least twelve. This dish is great with grilled bread, mustards, and pickles. Although I cook potatoes in the roasting pan (it's unbelievable what pork fat does to potatoes over a few hours), it can also be served with polenta or other vegetables.
Note: the interior temperature should be no less than 140F, but don't worry if it exceeds 180F: the goal is to cook the belly correctly, and that takes six hours.
title: Porchetta

description: Slightly tart and wonderfully roasty, this recipe, which doubles nicely, goes beautifully with Carnitas.
title: Roasted Salsa Verde

description: by the Editors of Publications International, Ltd.
title: Roasted Tomatillo Salsa

description: Classic salsa; very fast, simple and delicious. This one comes from a Susan Feniger recipe.
note: Getting good tomatoes and removing everything from their insides is key.  This is a carefully calibrated recipe: don't mess with it!
title: Salsa Fresca

description: Terrific condiment for fatty meat dishes, such as my Porchetta recipe.
title: Salsa Verde For Pork Dishes

description: Modified from a delicious Ina Garten recipe.
title: Slow-Roasted Spiced Pork

description: This one's a real winner. It's a Bobby Flay recipe found on Foodnetwork.com.
title: Spicy Citrus Bloody Mary

description: A terrific, near-vegetarian New York Time recipe
note: serves 8, takes an hour to prepare
title: Spicy Peanut Stew With Ginger and Tomato

description: Found on Rosie Hawthorne's Kitchens Are Monkey Business blog, this recipe goes great with carnitas.
title: Tangy Jalapeno Buttermilk Slaw

description: Modified from a recipe by Jessica's ex-sister-in-law Yvonne Inclan
note: This is a great, easy recipe.  Resist the temptation to add lime juice!
title: Tomatillo Avocado Salsa
